message: I think moving it to the pyramid project (in github) is a good idea. It will allow everyone to help out on the docs which is what I think everyone could help write them.

Well in my opinion... one of two things must happen, either Pyramid stop mentioning WebError altogether or WebError gets cleaned up.  The current state is bad imho.  Are we sure Ian Bicking is still looking for an official maintainer?
I think Ben is basically the maintainer already.
@chrismcdonough on irc someone complained they send him a docs patch many months ago and still no answer
WebError more or less works OK, the main issue is documentation. For example, there is no mention in Pyramid of how to disable debugging in production, which could lead to a huge security hole.
So my concrete proposal is that I'll get Ben to move it over to the pyramid github if you guys commit to pushing and releasing everything you think that needs to be fixed
Yeah I'm the one with a README waiting to be merged in... so if you can get WebError over to the Pyramid github I'll push that change right away and possibly work on further docs
Weberror just showed up in chris slides
I'll move it over to github tomorrow when I get back home
